title: "India can leverage US innovation to build AI tools for citizens," says White House AI Policy Advisor Sriram Krishnan
description: Sriram Krishnan, Senior White House Policy Advisor on Artificial Intelligence stressed on partnerships with India to leverage US innovation to build tools for Indian citizens.
content: New Delhi [India], February 18 (ANI): The United States regards India as a crucial potential partner in efforts to secure global supply chains for artificial intelligence and semiconductors. Underlining this facet, Sriram Krishnan, Senior White House... [3725 chars]

title: GalaxEye unveils Mission Drishti: India's AI-powered Earth observation satellite
description: The satellite will be able to process much of its data directly in space using artificial intelligence technology powered by Nvidia Jetson Orin computing hardware.
content:
Indian spacetech startup GalaxEye today announced "Mission Drishti," its groundbreaking satellite slated for a 2026 launch, featuring the world's first SyncFused OptoSAR architecture.

title: 'Is The Economy For Humans Or AI?' Zoho's Co-Founder Sridhar Vembu Weighs In
description: Chief Scientist & Co-Founder at Zoho Corporation, Sridhar Vembu, noted that it's pertinent to understand "who will be doing the buying and selling eventually", and whether the economy favours "humans or artificial intelligence".
content:

title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: Leading the Future of Artificial Intelligence
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the India AI Impact Summit 2026, aiming to position India as a leader in AI and fostering inclusive growth. The summit will feature global leaders, including French President Emmanuel Macron and UN Secretary-General António Guterres, discussing AI governance, infrastructure, and international cooperation.

title: Modi, Serbian Prez Aleksandar Vucic discuss expanding cooperation across sectors
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi joined forces with Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic to enhance collaboration across trade, investment, artificial intelligence, and more. Their dialogue also touched on pressing global matters, setting the stage for a deeper strategic and economic partnership between India and Serbia.
